lines.text: You don't want that junk. Diamonds would only cheapen you.
Yeah. But what a way to be cheapened.
You know, you remind me of an old Egyptian girlfriend of mine. The Sphinx.
Are you partial to females made of stone?

[to Nick Cochran]
You're up early for a loser.
My fatal charm. Never misses - except with women.
Well you annoyed me a little when you belted me with that blonde!
I'll go back one of these days, or my name isn't Lawrence C. Trumble.
What does the "C." stand for?
Cicero - but keep it under your hat.
What else would I do with it?

[referring to Julie Benson]
Besides her obvious talents, she also sings.
How 'bout two weeks salary in advance?
This is one time I won't say no.
Why don't you take that chip off your shoulder?
Every time I do, somebody hits me over the head with it.
The only time I'll ever get flowers will be at my funeral.
Thanks for the flowers.

[sarcastically]
I couldn't afford a wreath.
Not just you, everybody. Everybody's lonely and worried and sorry. Everybody's looking for something.
By the way, ever think of going home?
I can't go home any more than you can even if I wanted to.
Why not?
Oh, a little hassle over a redhead, somebody fired a shot, turned out to be me.
Other guy get killed?
No, but I got all the way to China before I found that out. Then I just, kept on going...
